alert.note: Alert for La Paz; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued August 21 at 10:48PM MST until August 21 at 11:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Central La Paz County in west central Arizona... North central Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... Northeastern Imperial County in southeastern California... Riverside County in southern California... * Until 1145 PM MST/1145 PM PDT/. * At 1048 PM MST/1048 PM PDT/, a wall of dust was along a line extending from Harcuvar to near Brenda to 11 miles west of Bouse to near Parker, moving southwest at 35 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 1 and 53. CA Interstate 10 between mile markers 138 and 156. US Highway 60 between mile markers 31 and 63. Locations impacted include... Parker, Blythe, Quartzsite, Nicholls Warm Springs, Palo Verde, Salome, Brenda, Buckskin Mountain Park, Blythe Airport, Bouse, Ripley, Vicksburg Junction, Midland, Wenden and Kofa Wildlife Refuge. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
